text: Bonifacio () is a town and commune near the southern tip of the island of Corsica, in the d√©partement of Corse-du-Sud, France. Its inhabitants are called Bonifaciens and the city was founded as a fortress and named after Boniface II of Tuscany in 828. Bonifacio is split into two sections. The vieille ville (old town), or la Haute Ville (the Upper city). ==Geography== Bonifacio is located directly on the Mediterranean Sea, separated from Sardinia by the Strait of Bonifacio. The commune includes the Lavezzi Islands. ==Famous people born in Bonifacio== * Tommaso Maria Zigliara (1833-1893), Roman Catholic cardinal, theologian, and philosopher. ==Other websites== *Official website (in French, translatable to English and other languages) ==Gallery== View of Bonifacio Category:Communes in Corse-du-Sud
title: Bonifacio
